question.text:
Which of the following characters are seen in an individual with trisomy of chromosome number 21?
A. Psychomotor and mental development is retarded
B. Mental retardation
C. Presence of gynaecomastia
D. Loss of skin pigmentation

options.text: Only A, B & C are correct

solution.text: Down's Syndrome: The cause of this genetic disorder is the presence of an additional copy of chromosome number 21 (trisomy of 21). This disorder was first described by Langdon Down (1866). The affected individual is short-statured with a small round head, furrowed tongue and partially open mouth. Palm is broad with characteristic palm crease. Physical, psychomotor and mental development is retarded.
